Question 64) It is difficult to imagine that in the 1990s, in a country with sectors of the population in absolute poverty and without a network of social benefits in which they support itself, a government can abandon the role of promoter of job generation, social assistance programs, , infrastructure development and promotion of excluded regions, expecting the market to have a proper response to all this.
In this context, the criticized posture of governments in the face of the social situation of the country coincided with the prioritization of what measures?
A) Expansion of investments in public companies and state banks.
B) Democratization of housing credit and the acquisition of popular housing.
C) Drinking individual tax burden and business tax contribution.
D) Reformulation of access to higher education and national scientific financing.
E) Reform of macroeconomic policies and inflationary control mechanisms.
